author: @Samantha-z7d5k
text:
"Honestly, when a man turns into a woman, it's way more painful than the other way around. You lose everything you thought was a part of you‚Äîyour muscles, your strength, even your manhood‚Äîit‚Äôs gone. The power it takes to transform is like going Super Saiyan 3‚Äîit‚Äôs raw, it‚Äôs intense. Your body literally reshapes, and it hurts like nothing you‚Äôve ever felt. Your chest hair, your leg hair, your arm hair, all of it disappears. It‚Äôs not just about changing the outside‚Äîit's like your identity is being torn apart. And it‚Äôs not just physical. Your voice, your whole aura, everything shifts. You‚Äôre losing parts of yourself that made you, you.

A boy turning into a girl? That‚Äôs a transformation that rips through your very soul. It‚Äôs harder, more excruciating, because it's not just changing your body, it's breaking the mold of who you are, what you've always known. Women becoming men, yeah, it‚Äôs tough, but it doesn‚Äôt hit with the same kind of devastating force. The pain, the power‚Äîit‚Äôs unmatched. It‚Äôs like breaking through a barrier you never thought you could cross. It‚Äôs a whole different level."

author: @Samantha-z7d5k
text:
"Look, when a man turns into a woman, it's a whole different level of pain. You lose your muscles, everything you were used to, even your manhood‚Äîit all changes. Your body doesn‚Äôt just shift; it tears at the very core of who you are. You lose your chest hair, your leg hair, arm hair‚Äîit‚Äôs like every part of you that made you a man is stripped away. And it‚Äôs not just physical. It's raw power, like going Super Saiyan 3‚Äîeverything hurts because you‚Äôre losing what defined you. The transformation is brutal, intense, and it rips you apart before it lets you rebuild stronger.

A boy turning into a girl? It's tougher. It's not just about becoming something else; it's like fighting against everything you‚Äôve ever known. I wouldn‚Äôt wish that kind of pain on anyone.

Now, when a woman becomes a man, it's not as bad. You‚Äôre still shifting, sure, but the transformation‚Äôs a bit less painful. Women start growing muscles, get that deeper voice‚Äîit‚Äôs not the same kind of violent change. There's a strength in that, too, but it doesn't hurt as much. It‚Äôs not raw power the way it is for a man turning into a woman. That‚Äôs just a different beast entirely."

author: @pigdaddy95
text:
@cobalt101¬† then why establish an entire career around it and market it to other people? 
Aside from the journey through the transition what other amazing talents/endearing appeal does this person have to offer? 
From what little that has been presented, it seems to be all about the transition. 
It never should be about anyone else but some people seem to make their content ABOUT sexuality for OTHER PEOPLE. 
Live your lives the way you want...everyone. Just don't expect the whole of creation to live by the standards of your choices.

author: @cobalt101
text:
@@pigdaddy95 Sorry, seems like my point wasn‚Äôt clear: other people are very obviously a big factor in his journey. That will never change. What I was really referring to was his own personal happiness. That happiness that you referred to, in Noah‚Äôs case, doesn‚Äôt revolve around other people. He didn‚Äôt transition just to ‚Äúestablish a career.‚Äù That‚Äôs absurd. He did it so that *he* could be happy in his own skin. All of the happy moments he showed in this video prove that this journey has made *him* happy. The only reason why he established an entire career around it is to help *others* find the same happiness that STARTED as a huge factor of *his* life. It quite literally could‚Äôve been as simple as ‚Äúbeing trans has been a huge part of my life so far. So I‚Äôm gonna share this with the world and make some money on the side.‚Äù
That‚Äôs it. 
He doesn‚Äôt rely on everyone else‚Äôs approval to support his transition. If he did, he would‚Äôve de-transitioned by now because‚Ä¶ well, just look at this very comment section. Count the amount of disapproving messages he‚Äôs received. Do any of them stop him? No. So how does his happiness rely on others alone when so many of these ‚Äúothers‚Äù hate his lifestyle while he is as happy as he has shown himself to be?

Not sure if my added message came through, so I‚Äôll say it here: being trans is also far from the only thing Noah‚Äôs career is based around. Not only is he a musician on top of his YouTube career, but he‚Äôs also made plenty of songs (dare I say a large majority) delving into general life experiences, including topics such as autism and mental health.

author: @cobalt101
text:
@@pigdaddy95 In addition, being trans is the farthest thing from the only topic Noah‚Äôs career is based on. I‚Äôm surprised you even imply it, to be honest, as you can‚Äôt really go too far on his channel without seeing *something* related to his music. He‚Äôs a musician, and though subjective, I believe he‚Äôs a talented one at that. 
Not all of his songs are about being trans either. Several deal with general experiences, including a song that delves into his life with autism.

author: @stephenmensah7558
text:
SCRIPTURE TEXT:

John 1:16 
"And of His fulness have all we received, and grace for grace."

Colossians  3:11  
"..Christ is all, and in all."

TITLE: "Jesus and the Sinner!"
_____________________________

*"All that Jesus does for lost sinners--He does freely, out of pure pity, kindness and love.*

Yet we are always looking for something in ourselves, to encourage us! 
On the other hand, we tend to look at some sin committed by us, which discourages us. Whereas we should look only to Jesus. I want now for a few minutes, to fix the eye of your mind on what Jesus does for sinners--how He acts toward them at the present day.

1]. *Jesus calls the sinner.* He says, "Come unto Me. Come, just as you are. Come, this moment. Come, for all that you need. Come, for all that you desire. Come, and be saved. Come, and I will satisfy you. Come, and commit all your concerns to Me, and I will make all things that occur, work together for your good."

2]. *Jesus receives the sinner when he comes.* He receives every sinner--however base, vile, or unworthy he may be! He receives the sinner graciously--pardoning every sin, forgiving and forgetting all that he has done amiss, and treating him with the utmost kindness.

3]. *Jesus cleanses the sinner.* In the fountain of His precious blood, and in the laver of His holy Word, He cleanses him from guilt and pollution, fitting him for holy service on earth, and for holier service in heaven. Nor is there any getting rid of guilt, but by His blood; nor of impurity, but by His Spirit working with His Word!

4]. *Jesus clothes the sinner.* Cleansed from guilt and filth--we are clothed in His garments of salvation, and are covered with His robe of righteousness. *All that is necessary for our honorable appearance in Heaven among the glorified, He undertakes to provide.*

Those who trust in Him, are completely nourished by Him. Jesus feeds the sinner. His flesh and blood becomes our daily food. We can no more live and be healthy, without nourishing food for the body--than we can live and be happy, without sweet and frequent nourishment from Christ. There is in the renewed soul, a craving for Christ--and it is never satisfied but as it realizes His presence, meditates on His Word, or is solaced with His love!

5]. *Jesus employs the sinner.* Having called, received, cleansed, clothed, and nourished him-- *He sets him to WORK.* 
‚ñ™Ô∏é *He gives him a cross to carry, and a plot in his vineyard to cultivate.*
‚ñ™Ô∏é He sends him to speak to others of His grace, and to manifest to others His temper and disposition. 
‚ñ™Ô∏é He sends him to the poor widow's cottage, to the sick man's chamber, and to the ignorant soul's home, and says: "Feed them for Me; comfort them for Me; and teach them for Me!"

6]. *Jesus comforts the sinner.* Yes, when he is depressed and discouraged, when he is low and cast down. He consoles by some special providence, by some seasonable portion of His Word, by the counsel of some friend, or by the sweet whispers of His Spirit.

7]. *Jesus assures the sinner.* Assures him of His love to him, of a saving interest in His finished work, and of a title to heavenly mansions! *When Jesus assures us--our doubts and fears depart, our unbelief is destroyed, and our souls are filled with peace and joy.*

8]. *Jesus visits the sinner.* He says, "I will come unto him." And He does come, and brings with Him--pleasant light, precious fruits, and joy and peace. He says, "I will come and sup with him, and he with Me." And He draws him out into such sweet, near and dear communion with Himself, that no costly meal, no delightful company, can be compared to it.

9]. *Jesus restores the sinner.* For as astonishing as it may appear, it is nevertheless true that we are prone to wander!
‚ñ™Ô∏é We leave light, for darkness!
‚ñ™Ô∏é We leave plenty, for poverty!
‚ñ™Ô∏é We leave joy, for sorrow!
‚ñ™Ô∏é We leave a paradise, for a desert!
*And having wandered we would never find our way back, if He did not come after us!* But, blessed be His holy name, He does! *And then He restores our souls, and again feeds us in green pastures, causing us to lie down beside the still waters!*

10]. *Jesus reproves the sinner.* However He may spare our persons, He never spares our sins! He visits our transgressions with the rod, and our iniquities with stripes! His reproofs are often sharp. *Cutting convictions, heavy losses, severe trials, perplexing troubles, bodily sickness, and painful bereavements, are some of the RODS which He employs.* But however numerous and heavy His strokes, they are lighter than our guilt, and fewer than our sins! *He deals with us as with sons. He chastens us for our profit, and to make us partakers of His holiness!*

11]. *Jesus glorifies the sinner.* Glorifies him with Himself, and confers on him an eternal weight of glory! What it is to be glorified, we do not fully know. At the least, it is to be freed from all that is sinful, painful, and degrading, and to be invested with all that is bright, beautiful, and blessed. It is to be made as like Jesus as possible, and to be with Him where He is forever!

O wondrous grace, of a wondrous Savior!

Believer, this precious Savior is yours!

‚óè Will you not love Him then?

‚óè Will you not bear witness to the power and sweetness of His love, to the joy and happiness that are found in His ways?

‚óè Will you not observe His statutes and keep His laws?

‚óè Will you not come out of the world which is peopled by His enemies, and be separated to Him? 
*Can you mingle with the carnal, and frequent places of worldly amusement?* Must you go to the world to be gratified and amused?

*Beware how you wound your precious Savior's loving heart!"*


~ James Smith
("Rills from the Rock of Ages", 1860)

author: @marbeltoast
text:
I‚Äôm not Noah, so maybe I‚Äôm the wrong person to answer this, but as a trans woman, I can tell you why I couldn‚Äôt be happy in a man‚Äôs body:

It wasn‚Äôt me. Not really. 
Nothing wrong with being a man, obviously. Someone else could have lived a long and happy life as that person in all those old family photos.

Just, not me.


If it doesn‚Äôt make sense to you, that‚Äôs because you‚Äôre not trans yourself. You‚Äôd have to be there to get it, and most people aren‚Äôt, so most people don‚Äôt. They come up with all manner of ideas to explain why other people transition that make sense in their head, but walking a mile in someone else‚Äôs shoes will just make you wonder why the shoes are so poorly fitted. We just have different sized feet, you know?

author: @nibcat88
text: @marbeltoast¬† thanks, but it still doesn't make much sense. If no physical aspect physically disturbs a person, it should be only about appearance, cultural conventions, clothes, image, behavior etc. And all above are just cultural things that are different in many countries, so there is nothing "real" about it. It sounds like someone just have high voice, but thinks their "real" voice is deep and it makes them unhappy. I don't think that personality somehow related to sex, race, gender, clothes or something like that. Before anything else, person is mind. Just my thoughts.

author: @marbeltoast
text:
The thing is, a physical aspect *can* disturb you. Gender dysphoria and body dysmorphia are terms we use to try and explain this feeling of wrong-ness with one's own physical form, but even amoung trans people, there is no one--size-fits-all answer. 


Some trans people don't experience dysphoria at all, but for others, it's the heaviest burden on their mind. Some trans people are happy with the shape their body takes and just focus on social/cultural stuff, others may opt for surgery. It's very case-by-case, because everyone's different. 

How someone looks, sounds, and is percieved and treated by others can all play a part in euphoria/dysphoria. It makes my day whenever someone refers to me with she/her pronouns, and the inverse is true with he/him.

I, personally, experience gender euphoria from seeing my body the way it is now. It is a joy, where in the past there was numbness, rather than a neutral feeling, where in the past there was pain. I can't claim to fully understand *why* it is this way; I'm not a neuroscientist, I'm just an ordinary person who is trans. I'm just playing the hand that whatever blend of nature and nurture has dealt me.

I hope that clears some things up? Feel free to ask any follow up questions you have; I'm happy to clear up whatever I can.

author: @nibcat88
text: @marbeltoast¬†Thanks for reply. Just in case, I'm not trying to offend anyone. I'm sorry that people are facing something like this. How often does anyone try to resolve it with just a psychologist without transitioning, and if so, how often do they succeed? Or it's unresolvable?

author: @marbeltoast
text:
So, two things, one I'm going to answer your question first, and the answer would be "not very often"/"the data is not reliable". The medical community is in agreement that transition *is* the treatment to gender dysphoria, and while individual people may disagree with that consensus, one wonders for what reason. As much as we ought to have faith in medical professionals to be unbiased, people like Andrew Wakefield (the father of the antivax movement) and those folks from centuries ago who would claim that science says that black people are less intelligent, well, those people have shown that human bias can bleed into what ought to be accepting the scientific truth, regardless of how it changes your previous beliefs.

This leads to my second point, being, well... Do you believe that transition is a negative thing? Something to be avoided if at all possible? If so, why?

I recognise that you are not intending to be offensive, and I do appreciate your good intentions, but as a trans person, there's something very knee-jerk reaction inducing about someone who's saying "And how often do people *not* do the thing that made you glad to be alive?" Like, the end goal is being happy in one' s own body; why does it matter how a person gets there?
